commit_message:
Fix frame traversal for __gc handler frames.

Reported by Changochen.
cve_desc: LuaJit through 2.1.0-beta3 has an out-of-bounds read because __gc handler frame traversal is mishandled.

commit_message:
Fix oobread and unaligned casts in the NE entrypoint logic ##crash

* Reported by @hmsec via huntr.dev
* Reproducer: nepocaligns
* BountyID: ec538fa4-06c6-4050-a141-f60153ddeaac
cve_desc: Out-of-bounds Read in r_bin_ne_get_entrypoints function in GitHub repository radareorg/radare2 prior to 5.6.8. This vulnerability may allow attackers to read sensitive information or cause a crash.

* Reported by @hmsec via huntr.dev

cve_desc: Out-of-bounds Read in r_bin_ne_get_entrypoints function in GitHub repository radareorg/radare2 prior to 5.6.8. This vulnerability may allow attackers to read sensitive information or cause a crash.

commit_message:
RDMA/rtrs-clt: Fix possible double free in error case

Callback function rtrs_clt_dev_release() for put_device() calls kfree(clt)
to free memory. We shouldn't call kfree(clt) again, and we can't use the
clt after kfree too.

Replace device_register() with device_initialize() and device_add() so that
dev_set_name can() be used appropriately.

Move mutex_destroy() to the release function so it can be called in
the alloc_clt err path.

Fixes: eab098246625 ("RDMA/rtrs-clt: Refactor the failure cases in alloc_clt")
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20220217030929.323849-1-haris.iqbal@ionos.com
Reported-by: Miaoqian Lin <linmq006@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Md Haris Iqbal <haris.iqbal@ionos.com>
Reviewed-by: Jack Wang <jinpu.wang@ionos.com>
Signed-off-by: Jason Gunthorpe <jgg@nvidia.com>
cve_desc: drivers/infiniband/ulp/rtrs/rtrs-clt.c in the Linux kernel before 5.16.12 has a double free related to rtrs_clt_dev_release.

commit_message:
RDMA/rtrs-clt: Fix possible double free in error case

Callback function rtrs_clt_dev_release() for put_device() calls kfree(clt)
to free memory. We shouldn't call kfree(clt) again, and we can't use the
clt after kfree too.

Replace device_register() with device_initialize() and device_add() so that
dev_set_name can() be used appropriately.

Move mutex_destroy() to the release function so it can be called in
the alloc_clt err path.

Fixes: eab098246625 ("RDMA/rtrs-clt: Refactor the failure cases in alloc_clt")
Link: https://lore.kernel.org/r/20220217030929.323849-1-haris.iqbal@ionos.com
Reported-by: Miaoqian Lin <linmq006@gmail.com>
Signed-off-by: Md Haris Iqbal <haris.iqbal@ionos.com>
Reviewed-by: Jack Wang <jinpu.wang@ionos.com>
Signed-off-by: Jason Gunthorpe <jgg@nvidia.com>
cve_desc: drivers/infiniband/ulp/rtrs/rtrs-clt.c in the Linux kernel before 5.16.12 has a double free related to rtrs_clt_dev_release.
